009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * This ImageJ plugin shows how data can be communicated from one
018 * plugin to another. In this example, ANOTHER plugin ({@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer})
019 * calculates a histogram that is subsequently retrieved by THIS
020 * plugin {@link Data_Transfer_Plugin_Consumer}. Data are stored as a property of the associated
021 * image (of type {@link ImagePlus}).
022 * Note that the stored data should contain no instances of self-defined
023 * classes, since these may be re-loaded when performing compile-and-run.
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 *
027 */
028public class Data_Transfer_Plugin_Consumer implements PlugInFilter {
029        ImagePlus im;
030        
031        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
032                this.im = im;
033                return DOES_ALL;}
034
035        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
036                String key = Data_Transfer_Plugin_Producer.HistKey;     // property key from the producer plugin class
037                Object prop = im.getProperty(key);
038                if (prop == null) {
039                        IJ.error("found no histogram for image " + im.getTitle());      
040                }
041                else {
042                        int[] hist = (int[]) prop;
043                        IJ.log("found histogram of length " + hist.length);
044                        // process the histogram ...
045                }
046                
047                // delete the stored data if not needed any longer:
048                // im.setProperty(key, null);
049                
050        }
051}
